credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Peace in a chariot, Sala di Recezione, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and color washes over black chalk ruled lines on beige wove paper
description: Peace stands within horse-drawn chariot, holding caduceus and branch. Fame flies between chariot and horses blowing her trumpet. Putto flies above, holding tablet inscribed PACE.
name: Drawing
